term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - relative retardation, R_rel, in planar chromatography
term.title: relative retardation

item.text: A term which is equivalent to relative retention used in column chromatography: the ratio of the R F value of a component to the R F value of a standard (reference) substance. Since the mobile phase front is common for the two components, the R F value can be expressed directly as the ratio of the distances travelled by the spot of the compound of interest (bi) and the reference substance (bst) respectively: R rel = R F i R F st = b i b st was used to express relative retardation in planar chromatography. Because of its identity with the symbol for peak resolution the symbol R rel is suggested for relative retardation in planar chromatography.

item.alttext: R rel = R F i R F st = b i b st

sources.item: PAC, 1993, 65, 819. 'Nomenclature for chromatography (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' on page 845 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199365040819)
